title: Internet Issues / Ping Issues
body:
This probably isn't the best place to make a post like this, but I am desperate for answers and I am sure a lot of you out there are tech savvy so I figured it's worth a shot. So I just recently ran into an issue where in my household if anyone is streaming anything in one of our rooms, it causes my ping to be very unstable (see below). This only occurs when someone is on our wifi connection and watching Netflix/Sling/Hulu etc. Also, I must add that this has not been an issue until recently and I haven't found any fixes. I ran a speedtest too and we are getting ~15mb/s download / ~1mb/s upload speed, if that makes any correlation.

_pasted log from pinging the League of Legends NA Server:_

replies.body: It looks like you're having some hiccups, like the 260, but it's not telling where it's coming from exactly.  This may depend on the level  of service your ISP is providing, too many devices could be throttling your connection.  A [power cycle ](https://kb.netgear.com/19755/How-to-Power-Cycle-Your-Home-Network?cid=wmt_netgear_organic) might help here.  Let me know, but test it in a custom.

Sample of my results after a power cycle.

Thanks for the info here.  Are you playing on wifi as well? I'd like to get more info on how you're routing to us and find the snag.  Download [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and run a route to the game server: 104.160.131.1.  Run it for about 5 minutes, replace the IP address with dashes on the first two rows only, and let me know what you find.
